meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic: When you have the <vocabulary>ambition</vocabulary> to do something, it feels like you're pointing at it with your heart. To say "heart pointing" in Japanese, you could say <reading>心ざし</reading> (こころざし), which is how this word was written in classical Japanese. In modern Japanese it's always 志, but the reading is exactly the same. Now get out there and heart point to your dreams!
